page.title: 18FARMING, BISHOPBRIGGS
page.content:
Although Bishopbriggs is essentially a suburb of Glasgow, around the edge of the town there are a number of{mixed {farms}which concentrate on fattening cattle for the city's meat market.
On the north-eastern side of the town between Bishopbriggs and Lenzie there are a number of{smallholdings} producing a variety of market garden produce including leeks, onions, small plants e.g. polyanthus.
Goat's milk and fresh eggs are also available locally from some smallholders reflecting the growing market for "natural foods".
